title: Revived Nalanda – the World’s Oldest Buddhist University – must be led by a Committed Buddhist as in the past
content: – by Shenali D Waduge – In 1193 A.D. Nalanda, the world’s oldest Buddhist university was ransacked and destroyed by foreign invaders led by the Turkish Bakhityar Khiliji because the 14 acre “giver of knowledge” was a strong pillar of Buddhism and attracted students from all over the then known world, including countries such…
